title.rendered: A lot of NFT sales could be bogus

content.rendered:
If you have also wondered about the valuations that some Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), you’re not alone. This trend has left many people wondering about why there are buyers paying exorbitant amounts for a piece of code.

However, new evidence indicates that a significant amount of sales come from traders what are they buying your own NFTs for artificially inflate their prices. This practice is called wash tradingand it is possible that an important part of the sales in the NFT world come from this technique.

Wash trading could be an explanation behind the high prices of NFTs || Source: CryptoPunks

For example, Reuters reports that 27 most expensive NFTs sold in January added together 1.3 billion dollars. However, these transactions came only from two wallets in LooksRare. Meanwhile, the top 100 sales in the month they added 2.3 billion dollarsdivided between only 16 wallets.

Modesta Masoit, director of finance research at the firm blockchain DappRadar told Reuters that these transactions concentrated in a limited number of wallets could indicate that it is not a real demand and that the transactions are not real.

In this regard, this market, as it is not supervised by the financial authorities, allows these practices to flourish. Do not forget to follow the official channels of Oink Oink..
